def_cn: (织物上的)绒毛，蓬松毛团;(小动物的)绒毛
def_en: Fluff consists of soft threads or fibres in the form of small, light balls or lumps. For example, you can refer to the fur of a small animal as fluff .
If you fluff something that you are trying to do, you are unsuccessful or you do it badly.

def_cn: 抖松(靠垫、羽毛等);使蓬松
def_en: If you fluff things such as cushions or feathers, you get a lot of air into them, for example by shaking or brushing them, in order to make them seem larger and lighter.
